Received: from KSLawdogg@... by imo-r20.mx.aol.com (mail_out_v28.32.) id a.2f.cc1d9fe (3877) for <nbwrpg@egroups.com>; Sun, 12 Nov 2000 11:43:37 -0500 (EST)

Subject: Re: Neo.
To: nbwrpg@egroups.com
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-Mailer: Unknown sub 107
From: KSLawdogg@...

    (JP, there's nothing wrong with you using BA's ship to make a sub.  A 
heavily armored sub that can take a lot of damage is one thing.  Just a sub 
as big and powerful as a base, that's a mobile base.  What has done to the 
Alliance Base is not mobile.  We can't have it fly around and shoot people, 
or retreat.  We had the five pieces in shuttles with a small escort.  We had 
to DISASSEMBLE the base.  We didn't activate any engines.  We're lucky no one 
attacked the shuttles, they probably could've caused one to crash and hinder 
our plans greatly, but no one did.
      True, we are locked on a island with a base and nice defenses.  But 
hey, how the hell is the Alliance supposed to get into the Cybertronian Fire? 
 We could bust through the shields after being bombed by missiles, EMP 
blasts, and autogun fire.  Then blow our way through the doors.  And then 
deal with the autoguns and flamethrowers in the halls, and the autoguns in 
rooms.  But that's the challenge!  That's what makes the game so fun.  You 
have to be clever.  Or you just wait until you outnumber your enemy.  
    Ally up with the Maximals or something.  Let the Maximals go in and take 
all the fire while you come in with your sub, wait unti the shields are down, 
surface, deploy your troops, and dive.
    Finally, the thing about knowing your plan.  We don't.  If we knew you 
were going to make a sub, we'd wait until we were sure of the location, and 
attack with all our men, or just strafe you with our jet people.  See, the 
way I see it, after you left, the Predacons got seperated and weak, while the 
Alliance just twiddled their thumbs and go strong enough to push anyone 
around.  Now you've come back, and coincidently a short while after you 
return the Preds are united and already plotting bigger things.  
    Luck smiled upon us.  But, JP, I'd be an idiot to tell you ways of 
bringing down the Alliance bases, or weaknesses.  But, here's a hint.  I've 
played a little game called StarCraft for a long time.  I've noticed, when 
I'm vastly outnumbered and outgunned, constant, strong attacks tend to weaken 
enemy forces.  To the point where my attacks don't kill mass troops, but they 
start destroying buildings.  Then the opponent gets weaker.  I destroy more 
buildings.  Until the point where I merely have to search and destroy the 
remnants.  There's my two cents)


Lord Unitron
KSLawDogg@...
